intro: Mulinum spinosum f. humilis, commonly known as the low spiny mullen, is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that belongs to the family Asteraceae. It features distinctive, spiny leaves with a woolly texture and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it a notable species in its native habitat.
